FXUS04 KWBC 241930
QPFPFD
 
QUANTITATIVE PRECIPITATION FORECAST DISCUSSION
NWS HYDROMETEOROLOGICAL PREDICTION CENTER CAMP SPRINGS MD
328 PM EDT SAT APR 24 2004
 
PRELIM DAY 1 AND DAY 2 QPF DISCUSSION
VALID APR 26/0000 UTC THRU APR 27/0000 UTC
REFERENCE AWIPS GRAPHICS UNDER...PRECIP ACCUM - 24HR
 
     
DAY 1...

THE CONTINUES TO BE POTENTIAL FOR WIDESPREAD HVY PCPN MOVG
ENEWD FROM THE SRN PLAINS INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY...LOWER OH
VALLEY AND MID WEST AHEAD OF THE MEAN TROF THAT IS EXPECTED TO
REMAIN OVR THE MID SECTION OF THE NATION.  WHILE THE STRONG CLOSED
LOW OVR THE CNTRL HIGH PLAINS WL CONT TO WEAKEN AS IT PUSHES
NEWD DAY 1...THE OVERALL MEAN TROF DOES NOT MOVE AS QUICKLY OR
WEAKEN...THUS CONTINUING HEAVY PCPN THREAT TO ITS EAST.  THE AMT
OF
PCPN FOR THIS UPCOMING DAY...HOWEVER...WL LIKELY NOT BE AS HEAVY
OR AS WIDESPREAD WITH VERY HEAVY AMTS AS WHAT OCCURRED OVR THE
PAST 24 HRS GIVEN WEAKER LOW TO MID LEVEL DYNAMICS COMPARED TO
THE PAST 24 HRS.  STILL...WITH ABUNDANT MOISTURE AND STILL
FAVORABLE
JET DYNAMICS ALONG THE FRONTAL BNDRY EXPECTED TO STRETCH FROM
CNTRL TO ERN TX...NEWD INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY/LOWER OH VALLEY
AND INTO THE MID WEST...HVY PCPN AMTS ARE LIKELY.    THERE ARE THE
USUAL DETAIL DIFFS WITH THE QPF BETWEEN THE OPERATIONAL ETA/GFS
AND THEIR CORRESPONDING SREF MEMBERS.   MAKING THINGS WORSE...IS
THE UNCERTAINTY IF THE MODELS ARE HANDLING THE CONVECTIVE VORT
OVR NERN TX CORRECTLY.   BOTH MODELS SUGGEST THIS VORT BREAKING
INTO TWO PIECES...ONE MOVG NEWD IN THE MEAN SWLY FLOW INTO THE MS
VALLEY/LOWER OH VALLEY AND MID WEST...WHILE ANOTHER PIECE PUSHES
MORE EWD INTO THE GULF COAST.   BOTH MODELS INITIALLY APPEAR
UNDERDONE WITH THE WELL DEFINED INFLOW BAND OF PCPN AHEAD OF
THIS VORT OVR LA..WRN MS AND ERN AR.  DAY 1 PROG INCREASED PCPN IN
THIS INFLOW AREA DURG THE FIRST 12 HRS WHEN EXTRAPOLATION OF IT
MAY WORK BETTER.   MODELS WERE MORE SIMILAR FARTHER TO THE
NORTHEAST ALONG THE FRONT INTO THE LOWER OH VALLEY AND INTO THE
MID WEST WITH .50-1"+ AMTS DEPICTED.

ACRS ERN TX INTO LA AND NRN TO WRN MS...THERE ARE LARGER MODEL
DIFF THAT DEVELOP TONIGHT AND CONT INTO TOMORROW WITH RESPECT
TO HOW MUCH ADDITIONAL CONVECTION FIRES AHEAD OF THE MAIN
FRONTAL BNDRY.  WITH ABUNDANT MOISTURE EXPECTED TO REMAIN ACRS
THIS AREA IN THE WAKE OF THIS MORNING CONVECTIVE COMPLEX..CONT
FAVORABLE UPR DYNAMICS IN THE RT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE UPR JET
AND CONVERGENCE FROM THE MAIN FRONTAL ZONE...BELIEVE THE HEAVIER
GFS DEPICTION IS BEST.  THE GFS IS...HOWEVER...SUFFERING FROM
APPARENT GRID SCALE PROBLEMS ACRS THIS REGION...BUT ITS OVERALL
IDEA OF HEAVIER QPF THAN THE ETA LOOKS GOOD.  SEVERAL OF THE
ETA...ETAKF AND RSM SREF MEMBERS...ALONG WITH THE CAN GEM SUPPORT
HEAVIER PCPN AMTS.  THE DAY 1 PROG LEANED TOWARD THE GFS...ALBEIT
SLIGHTLY TONED DOWN FROM THE GFS' BULLS EYE MAXES.  1-2"+ AREAL
AVG
AMTS DEPICTED DAY 1 ACRS ERN TX INTO LA...NRN TO CNTRL MS 


DAY 2...

...18Z UPDATE...

...ATLANTIC COAST STATES....

MODEL QPFS  ARE IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT CONCERNING THE
PRECIPITATION ALONG THE COLD FRONT PASSING THRU THE E COAST
STATES DAY 2...AND HAVE GOOD CONTINUITY FROM THE PREVIOUS
PACKAGE.  IN GENERAL...WE BLENDED THE ETA AND GFS QPFS BUT
BEEFED UP AMOUNTS A BIT OVER MS/AL FOR SUN EVE WHERE THE
HIGHEST PWS ARE EXPECTED AT THE TIME OF FROPA. WE PREFERRED 
THE ETA QPF OVER WV FOR SUN NIGHT AS THE GFS MAXIMUM OF 2.00
PLUS LOOKS A BIT GENEROUS. THE LIFTED INDEX FIELDS OF THE ETA
AND ESPECIALLY THE GFS SUGGEST ONLY MARGINAL TO WEAK 
INSTABILITY AS THE FRONT CROSSES THE APPALACHIANS SUN NIGHT.  AS
THE COLD FRONT REACHES THE PIEDMONT AREA MON AM...WE PLAYED UP
A DIURNAL MINIMUM OF FRONTAL ACTIVITY THRU CENTRAL  PORTIONS OF
GA/THE CAROLINAS/VA. HOWEVER...FRONTAL ACTIVITY  SHOULD RE-
INTENSIFY LATER MON AFTERNOON CLOSER TO THE COAST FROM SERN
VA SW THRU THE CAROLINAS INTO GA.    

....RIO GRANDE AREA...

WE   PLAYED UP THE IDEA THAT DRIER AIR FROM THE NE WOULD SWEEP
THE DEEPER MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY OUT OF TX TOWARDS THE RIO
GRANDE VALLEY. WE SHARPLY DECREASED THE ETA EXTENSION OF THIS
RIO GRANDE PCPN INTO W TX AS EXCESSIVE.PCPN THERE HAS SOME
UPPER SUPPORT FROM AN UPPER SHEAR AXIS DRIFTING SLOWLY S THRU 
TX MON...BUT THE ETA AREAL COVERAGE EXCEEDING .25 LOOKED
OVERDONE.     

ORAVEC/FLOOD

GRAPHICS AVAILABLE ON THE WEB AT WWW.HPC.NCEP.NOAA.GOV
